message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.SOC. 

The paper discusses algorithms for content recommendation in social networks, which involves learning from user reactions and endorsements from their friends. This falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also considers the exploration/exploitation dilemma, which is a common problem in reinforcement learning and decision making, making cs.SI (systems and control) another likely category. The use of side observations to improve learning also suggests information retrieval (cs.IR) as a possible category. Finally, the application of the algorithms to movie recommendation in social networks suggests that the paper may also fall under the category of social and information networks (cs.SOC).
